topics.learning_outcomes: Listen to stories. Tell stories creatively.

subtopics: Ask relevant questions to get better understanding and knowledge
topics.learning_outcomes: Use complete sentences to communicate information. Ask relevant questions to get better understanding and knowledge. Use appropriate language when talking to adults and friends. Participate in discussions using complete sentences. Participate in simple debates. Express opinion using appropriate language. Participate in simple dialogues.
Give physical descriptions of people. Give descriptions of places. Give descriptions of objects.
Participate in role play using appropriate vocabulary.
Say and respond to riddles. Recite tongue twisters.
Handle books. Discriminate print. Interpret pictures.
Identify and manipulate phonemes. Identify and manipulate syllables. Identify words in spoken sentences.
Sound out letters. Blend consonants and vowels to form syllables. Blend syllables to form words.
Read syllables aloud. Read words aloud with correct pronunciation. Read texts aloud with correct pronunciation and expression.
Recognise simple words. Identify proper and common nouns. Form plural and singular nouns.

Draw simple inferences from the information they have heard. Identify and express the main idea of the information they have listened to. Differentiate fact from opinion. Link their own life experiences to what they listen to. Deduce meaning of unfamiliar grade level words. Provide explicitly stated information in a given text. Make simple inferences of what they read. Make predictions based on given information.
Demonstrate correct posture when writing. Handle writing tools. Draw different objects.
Write letters. Write words legibly in manuscript form. Spacing words.
Communicate ideas through drawing. Use the main punctuation marks (capital letters and full stop). Write a complete sentence. Write a simple story of 3 to 4 sentences.
